pr_title: Use single map method where possible.

timeline.message:
Use single map method where possible.

Replace common usage patterns of java.util.Map with Java 8 methods such
as computeIfAbsent(), putIfAbsent(), etc.

timeline.bodyText: If there aren't any checked exceptions, you can probably do e.getSecurityErrorCodes().forEach(...) instead of a loop over the entry set.
timeline.author: ctubbsii

timeline.bodyText:
One of the great things about .computeIfAbsent() is that you don't need to assign it to a variable... you could just immediately use it on the next line:
tables.computeIfAbsent(tableId, k -> new HashSet<>()).addAll(ke.getValue());
timeline.author: ctubbsii

timeline.bodyText:
These look like they can simplify to:
binnedRanges.computeIfAbsent(location, k -> new HashMap<>())
  .computeIfAbsent(ke, k -> new ArrayList<>())
  .add(range);
timeline.author: ctubbsii

timeline.bodyText: This seems unrelated. If having trouble with the formatter, could just remove that comment at the end of the line, or put it above the log statement.
timeline.author: ctubbsii

replies.bodyText: Disregard this one. I fixed the formatting in the master branch.
replies.author: ctubbsii

timeline.message:
Use single map method where possible.

Added additional refactoring to the various Map methods. Namely chaining
commands where appropriate.
Merge branch 'map-methods' of github.com:jmark99/accumulo into map-methods
